member.summary: Initializes a new instance of SendMessageRequest.
member.param: The sender's phone number in E.164 format that is owned by the authenticated account.
The recipient's phone number in E.164 format. In this version, a minimum of 1 and upto 100 recipients in the list are supported.
The contents of the message that will be sent to the recipient. The allowable content is defined by RFC 5724.

member.name: P:Azure.Communication.Sms.Models.SmsRecipient.RepeatabilityRequestId
member.summary: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-ID and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-ID is an opaque string representing a client-generated, 36-character hexadecimal case-insensitive encoding of a UUID (GUID), identifier for the request.

member.name: P:Azure.Communication.Sms.Models.SmsRecipient.RepeatabilityFirstSent
member.summary: MUST be sent by clients to specify that a request is repeatable. Repeatability-First-Sent is used to specify the date and time at which the request was first created.eg- Tue, 26 Mar 2019 16:06:51 GMT.

member.name: M:Azure.Communication.Sms.SmsClient.SendAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,Azure.Communication.Sms.SmsSendOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends a SMS a phone number that is acquired by the authenticated account, another phone number.
member.param: The sender's phone number that is owned by the authenticated account.
The recipient's phone number.

The contents of the message that will be sent to the recipient. The allowable content is defined by RFC 5724. If the message has more than 160 characters, the server will split it into multiple SMSs automatically.
Optional configuration for sending SMS messages.
The cancellation token for the task.
member.exception: The server returned an error. See for details returned from the server.

member.name: T:Azure.Core.Argument
member.summary: Argument validation.

remarks.para: This class should be shared via source using Azure.Core.props and contain only common argument validation. It is declared partial so that you can use the same familiar class name but extend it with project-specific validation. To extend the functionality of this class, just declare your own partial class with project-specific methods.
Be sure to document exceptions thrown by these methods on your public methods.

member.summary: Returns the data written to the underlying buffer so far, as a .

member.summary: Returns the amount of data written to the underlying buffer so far.

member.name: P:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.Capacity
member.summary: Returns the total amount of space within the underlying buffer.

member.name: P:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.FreeCapacity
member.summary: Returns the amount of space available that can still be written into without forcing the underlying buffer to grow.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears the data written to the underlying buffer.
member.remarks: You must clear the before trying to re-use it.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.Advance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Notifies that amount of data was written to the output /.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to advance past the end of the underlying buffer.
member.remarks: You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.GetMemory(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a to write to that is at least the requested length (specified by ). If no is provided (or it's equal to 0), some non-empty buffer is returned.
member.remarks: This will never return an empty .
There is no guarantee that successive calls will return the same buffer or the same-sized buffer.
You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.GetSpan(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a to write to that is at least the requested length (specified by ). If no is provided (or it's equal to 0), some non-empty buffer is returned.
member.remarks: This will never return an empty .
There is no guarantee that successive calls will return the same buffer or the same-sized buffer.
You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.
